text.__SUMMARY__: Aspergillus luppii (also called A. aureofulgens) is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Flavipedes section. Aspergillus luppii produces the antimicrobics Curvularin and Dehydrocurvularin.
text.Growth and morphology: A. luppii has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below.
text.Further reading:
Caputo, O.; Viola, F. (1977). "Isolation of a, beta-dehydrocurvularin from Aspergillus aureofulgens". Planta Medica. 31 (1): 31–32. doi:10.1055/s-0028-1097485. ISSN 0032-0943. PMID 840925.
Gesellschaft für Arzneipflanzenforschung (Germany), Deutsche Gesellschaft für Arzneipflanzenforschung (1977). Planta medica. Hippokrates-Verlag.
Laskin, Allen I.; Lechevalier, Hubert A.; Company, Chemical Rubber (1988). CRC Handbook of Microbiology: pt. A. Antibiotics. CRC Press.
